name: Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY)
description: Provides a health cover of Rs. 5 lakhs per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization.
benefits: Cashless access to health care services.
Covers 3 days of pre-hospitalization and 15 days post-hospitalization expenses.
No restriction on family size, age or gender.
eligibility_criteria: Families identified as deprived rural families and identified occupational categories of urban workers' families as per the Socio-Economic Caste Census (SECC) 2011 data.

name: Post-Matric Scholarship for Students with Disabilities
description: Provides financial assistance to students with disabilities for post-matriculation courses enabling them to pursue higher education.
benefits: Maintenance allowance.
Reimbursement of compulsory non-refundable fees.
Book allowance and other grants.
eligibility_criteria: Students with 40% or more disability, studying in class 11th or above, with a parental annual income of less than Rs. 2.5 lakhs.

name: Atal Pension Yojana
description: A pension scheme mainly for the unorganized sector, providing a minimum guaranteed pension after the age of 60.
benefits: Guaranteed minimum monthly pension of Rs. 1,000 to Rs. 5,000.
The same pension is paid to the spouse after the subscriber's death.
The nominee receives the pension corpus on the death of both.
eligibility_criteria: Any Indian citizen between 18-40 years of age with a bank account. Should not be an income tax payer.

name: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana - Gramin (PMAY-G)
description: Aims to provide pucca houses with basic amenities to all houseless households and households living in kutcha and dilapidated houses in rural areas.
benefits: Assistance of Rs. 1.2 lakh in plain areas and Rs. 1.3 lakh in hilly areas.
Additional financial assistance through convergence with MGNREGA and SBM.
Provision for basic amenities like electricity, LPG, and water supply.
eligibility_criteria: Rural households that are homeless or living in kutcha/dilapidated houses, as identified in SECC 2011 data.

name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN)
description: Provides income support to all landholding farmer families in the country to supplement their financial needs.
benefits: Rs. 6,000 per year in three equal installments directly into the farmer's bank account.
Helps farmers meet agricultural and household needs.
eligibility_criteria: All landholding farmer families with cultivable land, excluding institutional landholders and higher-income category farmers.

name: National Social Assistance Programme (NSAP)
description: Provides financial assistance to the elderly, widows, and persons with disabilities in the form of social pensions.
benefits: Old Age Pension: Rs. 200-500 per month depending on age group.
Widow Pension: Rs. 300 per month.
Disability Pension: Rs. 300 per month for persons with 80% disability or more.
eligibility_criteria: BPL households as per SECC 2011; applicable to elderly (60+), widows (40–59), and disabled persons (80%+ disability).

name: Stand-Up India Scheme
description: Facilitates bank loans between Rs. 10 lakh and Rs. 1 crore to at least one Scheduled Caste (SC) or Scheduled Tribe (ST) borrower and at least one woman borrower per bank branch for setting up a greenfield enterprise.
benefits: Composite loan (inclusive of term loan and working capital).
Maximum 85% of project cost can be covered by the loan.
Support for setting up manufacturing, services, or trading units.
eligibility_criteria: SC/ST and/or women entrepreneurs above 18 years for greenfield projects; borrower should not have defaulted in any bank.

name: Ayushman Bharat Health and Wellness Centres (AB-HWCs)
description: Transforms existing sub-health centres and primary health centres into health and wellness centres for comprehensive primary health care.
benefits: Free essential drugs and diagnostic services.
Services for maternal and child health, NCD screening, and elderly care.
Telemedicine and referral services.
eligibility_criteria: All citizens can avail services at these centres without any discrimination.

name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)
description: A crop insurance scheme providing comprehensive insurance coverage and financial support to farmers in case of crop failure due to natural calamities, pests, and diseases.
benefits: Low premium rates—2% for Kharif, 1.5% for Rabi, up to 5% for commercial and horticultural crops.
Quick claim settlement and indemnity coverage for failed crops.
Access via notified insurance companies empanelled per state.
eligibility_criteria: All farmers growing notified crops in notified areas; loanee farmers enrolled automatically through banks, others can voluntarily enroll.

name: Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY)
description: Empowers women from Below Poverty Line households by providing free LPG connections to reduce health hazards associated with traditional cooking fuels.
benefits: Free LPG connection with financial support for deposit and installation.
Subsidized refills via Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) into bank accounts.
Improved health outcomes by reducing indoor air pollution.
eligibility_criteria: Women in BPL households without LPG connection; income limits and targeted via poverty line data.

name: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana – Urban (PMAY-U)
description: Enables affordable housing construction for urban poor via subsidies, credit-linked loans, and beneficiary-led construction or enhancement.
benefits: Credit-linked subsidy up to 6.5% on home loans for EWS, LIG, MIG applicants.
In-situ slum rehabilitation using land as resource.
Affordable housing in partnership with private and public sectors.
eligibility_criteria: Urban poor who are first-time homebuyers; family income limits apply per EWS/LIG/MIG categories.

name: Subhadra Yojana (Odisha)
description: Odisha state’s women-centric scheme providing direct financial support to economically weaker women aged 21–60 over five years.
benefits: ₹50,000 spread over five years via two ₹5,000 installments annually.
Disbursement through Aadhaar-linked bank accounts via DBT.
Incentives like additional ₹500 for beneficiaries with top digital transaction counts.
eligibility_criteria: Women aged 21–60 years from economically weaker households; excludes government employees and those receiving other monthly scheme benefits.

name: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA)
description: Enhances livelihood security in rural areas by providing at least 100 days of guaranteed wage employment in a financial year to every household whose adult members volunteer to do unskilled manual work.
benefits: Guaranteed 100 days of wage employment at a stipulated minimum wage.
Creation of durable assets like roads, canals, and ponds in rural areas.
Social protection for the most vulnerable people living in rural India.
eligibility_criteria: Every adult member of a rural household who is willing to do unskilled manual work and has applied for a Job Card.

name: Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana (PMMY)
description: Provides loans up to Rs. 10 lakh to non-corporate, non-farm small/micro-enterprises through various financial institutions.
benefits: Access to formal credit for small businesses, often without collateral.
Loans categorized into 'Shishu' (up to ₹50,000), 'Kishor' (up to ₹5 Lakh), and 'Tarun' (up to ₹10 Lakh).
Promotes entrepreneurship at the grassroots level.
eligibility_criteria: Any Indian citizen with a business plan for a non-farm sector income-generating activity like manufacturing, processing, trading, or services.

name: Swachh Bharat Mission (SBM)
description: A nationwide campaign to eliminate open defecation and improve solid waste management in urban and rural areas.
benefits: Financial incentives for constructing individual household latrines (IHHL).
Focus on achieving an Open-Defecation Free (ODF) and clean India.
Promotes hygiene, scientific waste management, and sanitation.
eligibility_criteria: All rural and urban households without access to toilets; urban local bodies and gram panchayats for community-level initiatives.

name: National Health Mission (NHM)
description: Encompasses two sub-missions (Rural and Urban) to provide accessible, affordable, and quality healthcare to all citizens, especially the vulnerable.
benefits: Strengthening of public health infrastructure (Sub-Centres, PHCs, CHCs).
Focus on reducing Maternal and Infant Mortality Rates.
Provides free universal immunization services through Mission Indradhanush.
eligibility_criteria: All citizens, with a special focus on rural populations, urban poor, women, and children.

name: Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana (PMKVY)
description: A flagship skill certification scheme to enable a large number of Indian youth to take up industry-relevant skill training that will help them secure a better livelihood.
benefits: Free short-duration skill training and certification based on National Skills Qualification Framework (NSQF).
Monetary reward and government certification upon successful assessment.
Improved employability and support for entrepreneurship.
eligibility_criteria: Any Indian national who is an unemployed youth, or school/college dropout. Aadhar Card is mandatory.

name: PM Street Vendor's AtmaNirbhar Nidhi (PM SVANidhi)
description: Provides collateral-free working capital loans up to Rs. 10,000 (first tranche), Rs. 20,000 (second tranche), and Rs. 50,000 (third tranche) to street vendors to restart their businesses.
benefits: Collateral-free loans up to Rs. 10,000 initially, then Rs. 20,000 and Rs. 50,000 in subsequent tranches.
7% interest subsidy from the government on regular repayment.
Cashback up to Rs. 1,200 per year on digital transactions.
No processing fee or penalty charges.
eligibility_criteria: Street vendors who were vending as on or before March 24, 2020, in urban areas with valid Certificate of Vending/Identity Card or Letter of Recommendation from ULB/TVC.

name: PM Vishwakarma Scheme
description: Provides comprehensive support to traditional artisans and craftspeople engaged in 18 family-based traditional trades including training, credit, and modern tools.
benefits: PM Vishwakarma Certificate & ID Card for recognition.
Basic training (40 hours) and advanced training (15 days) with Rs. 500/day stipend.
Toolkit incentive up to Rs. 15,000 via e-vouchers.
Collateral-free loans up to Rs. 1 lakh (first tranche) and Rs. 2 lakh (second tranche) at 5% interest.
Rs. 1 per digital transaction up to 100 transactions monthly.
eligibility_criteria: Artisan or craftsperson above 18 years, working in one of 18 eligible trades, engaged in self-employment in unorganized sector. Only one member per family eligible.

name: PM MITRA (Mega Integrated Textile Regions and Apparel) Parks
description: Establishes integrated textile parks to create world-class industrial infrastructure for the textile industry, covering the entire value chain from spinning to garment manufacturing.
benefits: Development capital support up to Rs. 500 crore per park.
Competitive incentive support up to Rs. 300 crore per park.
Integrated textile value chain at one location.
Expected to generate 1 lakh direct and 2 lakh indirect jobs per park.
Convergence with other government schemes.
eligibility_criteria: Textile manufacturers and entrepreneurs setting up units in designated PM MITRA parks across 7 selected sites in Tamil Nadu, Telangana, Gujarat, Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, and Maharashtra.

name: National Pension System (NPS)
description: A voluntary, market-linked pension scheme providing retirement savings options with professional fund management and tax benefits.
benefits: Tax deduction up to Rs. 1.5 lakh under Section 80C and additional Rs. 50,000 under 80CCD(1B).
Flexible investment options across equity, corporate bonds, government securities.
Low-cost investment product with transparent fund management.
Portability across jobs and locations.
Choice of fund managers and investment patterns.
eligibility_criteria: Any Indian citizen (resident/non-resident/OCI) between 18-70 years of age. Aadhaar mandatory for registration.

name: PM Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana (PM-GKAY)
description: Provides free additional food grains to all National Food Security Act (NFSA) beneficiaries to address COVID-19 induced economic disruptions.
benefits: 5 kg free food grains (wheat/rice) per person per month.
1 kg free pulses per family per month.
Additional to regular NFSA allocations.
Covers approximately 80 crore beneficiaries.
eligibility_criteria: All beneficiaries covered under National Food Security Act 2013 - Antyodaya Anna Yojana (AAY) and Priority Household (PHH) categories.

name: Ladli Behna Yojana (Madhya Pradesh)
description: Madhya Pradesh state scheme providing direct financial assistance to women from economically weaker sections.
benefits: Rs. 1,250 per month direct cash transfer to eligible women.
Disbursement through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) into bank accounts.
Aimed at women's economic empowerment and financial independence.
eligibility_criteria: Women aged 21-60 years, from economically weaker sections, married/widowed/divorced/abandoned, with family annual income below Rs. 2.5 lakh.

name: Karnataka Gruha Lakshmi Scheme
description: Karnataka state scheme providing monthly financial assistance to women heads of families as part of the Five Guarantees.
benefits: Rs. 2,000 monthly cash assistance to women heads of families.
Direct Benefit Transfer to bank accounts.
Part of Karnataka's Five Guarantees scheme.
eligibility_criteria: Women heads of families residing in Karnataka, holding valid ration cards, with family annual income criteria as specified by the state government.

name: Yuva Nidhi Scheme (Karnataka)
description: Karnataka state scheme providing unemployment allowance to educated youth to support them during job search period.
benefits: Rs. 3,000 per month for graduates.
Rs. 1,500 per month for diploma holders.
Financial support for up to 2 years.
Skills development and placement support.
eligibility_criteria: Karnataka residents aged 18-25 years with graduation/diploma, family annual income below Rs. 8 lakh, registered as unemployed.

name: Anna Bhagya Scheme (Karnataka)
description: Karnataka state scheme providing additional free rice to BPL families beyond the central government allocation.
benefits: Additional free rice allocation beyond NFSA entitlement.
Ensures food security for BPL families.
Distribution through Fair Price Shops (FPS).
eligibility_criteria: Families holding valid BPL ration cards in Karnataka state, as per state government criteria.

name: Shakti Scheme (Karnataka)
description: Karnataka state scheme providing free bus travel for women in state transport buses.
benefits: Free travel in Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) buses for women.
Covers all ordinary and express services within Karnataka.
No income or age restrictions.
eligibility_criteria: All women residents of Karnataka state, no specific income or age criteria.

name: Lakshmir Bhandar (West Bengal)
description: West Bengal state scheme providing monthly financial assistance to women for economic empowerment.
benefits: Rs. 1,000 per month for SC/ST women.
Rs. 500 per month for general category women.
Direct bank transfer to women beneficiaries.
Aims to improve women's financial condition.
eligibility_criteria: Women aged 18-60 years, head of family, holding valid voter ID and Aadhaar card, residing in West Bengal.

name: Kanyashree Prakalpa (West Bengal)
description: West Bengal state scheme encouraging girls' education and preventing child marriage through conditional cash transfers.
benefits: Rs. 750 annual scholarship for girls in classes VIII-XII (K1).
Rs. 25,000 one-time grant for unmarried girls aged 18 and pursuing higher education/technical training (K2).
Encourages girls to stay in school and delay marriage.
eligibility_criteria: Girls studying in classes VIII-XII (K1) or unmarried girls aged 18 pursuing higher studies (K2), with family income below Rs. 1.2 lakh annually.

name: Sabooj Sathi (West Bengal)
description: West Bengal state scheme providing free bicycles to students to improve school retention and access.
benefits: Free bicycles to students of classes IX-XII.
Promotes eco-friendly transportation.
Encourages continued education, especially for girls.
Improves school attendance and reduces dropout rates.
eligibility_criteria: Students studying in classes IX-XII in government and government-aided schools in West Bengal.

name: Mukhyamantri Chiranjeevi Yojana (Rajasthan)
description: Rajasthan state health insurance scheme providing universal health coverage to all residents.
benefits: Health coverage up to Rs. 25 lakh per family per year.
Covers both government and private hospitals.
Additional Rs. 10 lakh for accidental coverage.
Cashless treatment facility.
eligibility_criteria: All residents of Rajasthan, universal coverage without income restrictions.

name: Indira Rasoi Yojana (Rajasthan)
description: Rajasthan state scheme providing subsidized meals to ensure food security for urban poor.
benefits: Full meal at Rs. 8 and half meal at Rs. 5.
Breakfast available at Rs. 5.
Nutritious meals prepared under hygienic conditions.
Covers urban areas across Rajasthan.
eligibility_criteria: Available to all citizens, with special focus on urban poor, laborers, and economically weaker sections.

name: Kalaignar Magalir Urimai Thogai Scheme (Tamil Nadu)
description: Tamil Nadu state scheme providing monthly financial assistance to women heads of families.
benefits: Rs. 1,000 per month to eligible women.
Direct Benefit Transfer to bank accounts.
Supports women's economic independence.
Covers various categories of women beneficiaries.
eligibility_criteria: Women heads of families in Tamil Nadu, with specific income and residency criteria as defined by the state government.

name: Chief Minister's Breakfast Scheme (Tamil Nadu)
description: Tamil Nadu state scheme providing nutritious breakfast to school children to improve enrollment and reduce malnutrition.
benefits: Free nutritious breakfast to students in government schools.
Covers classes I-V initially, expanded to higher classes.
Improves school attendance and learning outcomes.
Addresses malnutrition among children.
eligibility_criteria: Students enrolled in Tamil Nadu government and government-aided schools from classes I-V (expanded to higher classes).

name: Zero-Ticket Bus Travel Scheme for Women (Tamil Nadu)
description: Tamil Nadu state scheme providing free bus travel for women in state transport buses.
benefits: Free travel in Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation buses for women.
Covers all routes within Tamil Nadu.
No income or age restrictions.
Promotes women's mobility and empowerment.
eligibility_criteria: All women, no specific eligibility criteria based on income or other factors.

name: Vahli Dikri Yojana (Gujarat)
description: Gujarat state scheme providing financial assistance for education and welfare of girl children.
benefits: Financial assistance for girl child education.
Rs. 4,000 at birth, Rs. 6,000 at 1st standard admission.
Rs. 6,000 at 9th standard admission, Rs. 1 lakh at 18 years for higher education.
Promotes girl child education and prevents female foeticide.
eligibility_criteria: Girl children born in Gujarat families with annual income below Rs. 2 lakh, maximum two girl children per family eligible.

name: Mukhyamantri Kisan Sahay Yojana (Gujarat)
description: Gujarat state crop insurance scheme providing compensation to farmers for crop loss due to natural calamities.
benefits: Compensation up to Rs. 20,000 per hectare for rain-fed crops.
Rs. 25,000 per hectare for irrigated crops.
Coverage for damage above 33% of normal yield.
No premium to be paid by farmers.
eligibility_criteria: All farmers in Gujarat growing notified crops, automatic coverage without premium payment by farmers.

name: Jal Jeevan Mission
description: Ensures piped water supply (Har Ghar Nal Se Jal) to all rural households by 2024.
benefits: 55 liters per person per day of potable water through individual household tap connections.
Improved water quality and reliability.
Community participation in water resource management.
Integration with other government schemes.
eligibility_criteria: All rural households across India, with priority to water-stressed and drought-prone areas.

name: PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana
description: Provides subsidized rooftop solar installations to generate free electricity for households.
benefits: Up to 300 units of free electricity per month.
Central subsidy up to Rs. 78,000 for systems up to 3kW.
Easy financing through subsidized loans.
Reduce electricity bills and carbon footprint.
eligibility_criteria: All residential consumers across India, with Aadhaar and electricity connection mandatory.

name: Unified Pension Scheme (UPS)
description: New pension scheme for central and state government employees providing assured pension benefits.
benefits: Assured pension at 50% of average basic pay drawn over last 12 months of service.
Assured family pension at 60% of employee's pension.
Assured minimum pension of Rs. 10,000 per month.
Inflation indexation of pension.
eligibility_criteria: Central and state government employees joining service from April 1, 2025, onwards.

name: National Education Policy (NEP) 2020 Implementation
description: Comprehensive reform of education system from school to higher education with focus on holistic development.
benefits: Foundational Literacy and Numeracy (FLN) mission.
Multiple entry and exit options in higher education.
Academic Bank of Credits for credit transfer.
Integration of vocational education from Grade 6.
eligibility_criteria: All students in Indian education system from pre-primary to higher education levels.
